communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OPM FOIA Org Chart
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The current org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office, reflecting vacancies as of February 18, 2025.

2. The org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office on January 18, 2025, reflecting any vacancies on that date. 

Request for Expedited Processing

I hereby request expedited processing of this request. CNN reported all employees of OPM FOIA were terminated on or around February 17, 2025. If true, this would render the office unable to meet its statutory obligations, potentially violating the Anti-Deficiency Act, and thus, raising issues as to whether the President’s team is in violation of the Constitution’s Take Care clause.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Acknowledgment of FOIA Request No. 25-OESPIM-1282-F
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Free: 
This email acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM) . Your request was received by this office on February 19, 2025, and was assigned tracking number 25-OESPIM-1282-F. You requested the following: 
1. The current org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office, reflecting vacancies as of February 18, 2025.2. The org chart for OPM’s FOIA Office on January 18, 2025, reflecting any vacancies on that date. 
Your request for expedited processing has been denied because you have not demonstrated that you meet the threshold requirement of being a person primarily engaged in disseminating information. Please note that due to current resource limitations we are experiencing prolonged delays in the processing of requests as we are working through a backlog. 
If you are not satisfied with OPM’s determination, you may administratively appeal in writing by email to OGCAtty@opm.gov. An appeal should include a copy of the initial request, a copy of this email denying your request for expedited processing, and a statement explaining why you believe the decision is wrong. Appeals must be electronically transmitted within 90 calendar days of the date of this email. 
Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS by e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or by mail at: 
Office of Government Information Services 
National Archives and Records Administration 
8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS 
College Park, Maryland 20740-6001 
We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. Sincerely, 
FOIA Requester Service Center 
Office of Personnel Management

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Amazon inland empire (San Bernardino City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that Amazon has been active in the Inland Empire and among Inland Empire public agencies: https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2023-12-05/leaked-document-offers-glimpse-into-how-amazon-amasses-influence-in-the-inland-empire

https://twitter.com/LorenaSGonzalez/status/1732047860701782381/photo/4

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the city/agency by Amazon 

2) A copy of any incident reports relating to Amazon, including attachments and media.

3) Any emails between the city/district and Amazon employees, including attachments and media. Please limit search to between Jan 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed

4) Any grants, gifts, contracts, between this agency and Amazon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records related to the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop, age 52, at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport, including:

All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the investigation, detainment, and arrest of Mr. Allsop on DUI charges at the airport, beginning from initial contact near or before 7:00 a.m.

Surveillance or security footage from the airport (if available and not exempt), particularly any camera angles showing the pilot’s interaction with security, gate agents, or passengers.

Mr. Allsop was reportedly preparing to operate Southwest Flight 3772 to Chicago and was arrested before takeoff for allegedly showing visible signs of intoxication. The incident resulted in significant flight delays and raised public interest about aviation safety and pilot screening.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: RE: Open Records Request
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for your request for records under the Georgia Open Records Act.  However, we regret to inform you that we are unable to fulfill your request for information at this time. The records you have requested are exempt from public disclosure under Georgia Code § 50-18-72(a)(4). According to this provision, public disclosure is not required for:

"Records of law enforcement, prosecution, or regulatory agencies in any pending investigation or prosecution of criminal or unlawful activity, other than initial police arrest reports and initial incident reports; provided, however, that an investigation or prosecution shall no longer be deemed to be pending when all direct litigation involving such investigation and prosecution has become final or otherwise terminated; and provided, further, that this paragraph shall not apply to records in the possession of an agency that is the subject of the pending investigation or prosecution."

As the records you requested pertain to an ongoing investigation, they fall under this exemption and are unavailable until the case is officially closed.

Please note that this information has been provided in good faith as required under the Georgia Open Records Act, O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70, and should be used in accordance with Georgia law.  Any use of this information in violation of Georgia law or applicable state statutes is strictly prohibited.

Thank you,


Dawoud Stevenson
Senior Director of Program Management
Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport
400 Airways Avenue, Savannah, GA  31408
Phone:  912-964-0514
www.flySAV.com<http://www.flysav.com/>

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA Request – Bodycam and Related Records – Jan. 15, 2025 Arrest of David Allsop (Flight 3772, DUI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

This is a follow-up to my January 2025 request regarding the January 15, 2025 arrest of Southwest Airlines pilot David Allsop at Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport on DUI charges.

I understand the requested body-worn camera footage and surveillance video are currently exempt under O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72(a)(4), due to a pending investigation or prosecution.

Accordingly, I respectfully request the following:

1. Once the investigation and/or prosecution concludes, and the exemption no longer applies, please release the requested footage directly to me.
2. If release is not automatic, I ask that your office notify me when the case is closed and the records become subject to disclosure.
3. If any portion of the requested records can be released now—such as a redacted incident report, officer roster, or chain of custody log—I respectfully request those materials as well.

This request is made in the public interest and is not for commercial use. The footage pertains to a serious aviation safety matter involving the arrest of a pilot scheduled to operate Flight 3772, which generated significant public concern.

Thank you for your continued cooperation.

Sincerely,  
Police Cam News  
requests@muckrock.com

USCIS FOIA - Case status change   (https://first.uscis.gov/favicon.ico)  
Matthew Hoppock, 
Your USCIS FOIA/PA request COW2021000161 has been completed.  A Final Action Letter with important information regarding your request has been electronically delivered to the myUSCIS account you created. 
Please log into your account at https://first.uscis.gov to retrieve, view, and download the results. (https://first.uscis.gov) 

If you have troubles logging into your account, please call the USCIS Contact Center toll-free at 800-375-5283. 
For people who are deaf, hard of hearing or have a speech disability: TTY 800-767-1833. 

 Thank you, 

 Jarrod Panter 
 Acting Chief FOIA Officer

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: June 12, 2018 Media Response to Query
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A memo called "Media Response to Query" with the issue stated as "Opening of the HFE Office" and dated June 12, 2018. This was emailed by Donna Campagnolo on June 12, 2018 to Daniel Renaud as an attachment called "HFE - RTQ.docx"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

Thank you for your email. Here is a link to check your status online. You may check the status of your FOIA request at: https://first.uscis.gov/#/check-status<https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ffirst.uscis.gov%2F%23%2Fcheck-status&data=04%7C01%7CGeorgette.L.Shirk%40uscis.dhs.gov%7Ca00b973f70bb44e81a1708d937348115%7C5e41ee740d2d4a728975998ce83205eb%7C0%7C0%7C637601520900411926%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=VwLBIStvX51HnuI0trGESav5VWQ3Q3dsMtHIfxei2hI%3D&reserved=0>

By checking your status online, this frees up our staff to process pending requests. We are currently experiencing a high volume of incoming requests. To ensure fairness for all FOIA requesters, FOIA operates on a first in, first out basis.

Your request is currently number 836 of 1343 pending requests. The estimated completion date is only an estimate. It depends on the complexity of the case and the complexity of the cases in line. The number in line is the best estimate of when your case will be completed.

Samantha

Matthew Hoppock, 
Your USCIS FOIA/PA request COW2021000159 has been completed.  A Final Action Letter with important information regarding your request has been electronically delivered to the myUSCIS account you created. 
Please log into your account at https://first.uscis.gov to retrieve, view, and download the results. (https://first.uscis.gov) 

If you have troubles logging into your account, please call the USCIS Contact Center toll-free at 800-375-5283. 
For people who are deaf, hard of hearing or have a speech disability: TTY 800-767-1833.

title: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Inspector General closed cases 2016 (Defense Intelligence Agency, Office of the Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

a copy of the list or printout or database listing of Inspector General investigations closed/reports completed during calendar year 2016. If the list is organized by FY rather than calendar year, the FY 2016 list is sufficient for this request. If no central list or database exists, then I request that the equivalent information be provided in the form of copies of the cover sheet or first page of each IG report completed during calendar year 2016.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Emma/MuckRock.com,

Unfortunately, the Inspector General's office does not handle Freedom of Information requests. We ask that you email DIA's Freedom of Information  office email distro for request(s) such as yours below.
They can be reached at foia1@dodiis.mil<mailto:foia1@dodiis.mil>

Thank you very much.

William Seward
Investigator
Office of the Inspector General
Defense Intelligence Agency

communications.communication:
Classification: UNCLASSIFIED

Greetings,

Thank you for contacting the Defense Intelligence Agency. This email is to provide you with an update on your Freedom of Information Request FOIA 00111-2022. This case is currently being tasked out to other elements within the agency and are currently being processed. We will make every effort to process your request as soon as possible and solicit your patience and understanding. However, please keep in mind, we are backlogged with over 1,800 FOIA cases and work on the cases based on date they are received and complexity of each case.

Warm Regards,
DIA FOIA Team

title: SWAT Call Outs (Santa Ana Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs (Santa Ana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Expedited FOIA requests (Department of Labor)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: DOL Grant of Fee Waiver
communications.communication:
March 19, 2025 Mr. Adam  Steinbaugh 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR182855 
263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA  02115 Re: Freedom of Information Act Request No. # 2025-F-08970 DearAdam  Steinbaugh: Thisletter responds to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of March 11, 2025 in which you requested To Whom It May Concern:Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:A copy of any FOIA request (including any request to expedite the request) in which a request to expedite production (on the basis of newsworthiness or an urgency to inform the public) was granted. This request is limited to requests received on or after January 1, 2024.The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Adam Steinbaugh. Your request was received in our office on March 13, 2025,and assigned FOIA tracking number 2025-F-08970. Youhave requested a waiver of fees. In order to determine whetheryour request qualifies for a waiver of fees, pursuant to 29 CFR § 70.41, we must evaluate whetherdisclosure of the requested information is: not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. 
Basedon the above criteria, we have determined that you adequately addressed thestatutory requirements for a waiver of fees in your March 11, 2025, request. You have been granted a waiver of all fees associated with producing therecords requested. Please be advised, however, granting this waiver of fees does notautomatically apply to future requests. Requests for waivers of fees are determined on a case-by-case basis. Ifyou have any questions concerning my response to your request pleasecontact Viola Gonzales, Government Information Specialist at 936-270-1330. In addition, itwould be helpful to include the tracking number in any submission or to have itavailable at the time of a call. Sincerely, AgencyDisclosure Officer

communications.subject: FOIA 2025-F-08977/Expedited Processing FOIA
communications.communication:
This is in response to your Freedomof Information request received in our office on 13/13/25 requesting the abovementioned records.  These records are nowavailable and have been enclosed for your information. You will note some informationhas been removed from the documents. This is authorized under the rules and regulations, includingexemptions, contained in the Freedom of Information Act and 29 CFR Part 70.  For specific numbers and wording ofexemptions, please refer to Attachment #1. You have the right to appeal this decision with theSolicitor of Labor within 90 days from the date of this letter.  Theappeal must state, in writing, the grounds for the appeal, including anysupporting statements or arguments.  The appeal should also include a copyof your initial request and a copy of this letter. If you appeal, you may mail your appeal to: Solicitor ofLabor, U.S. Department of Labor, Room N-2420, 200 Constitution Avenue, N.W.,Washington, D.C. 20210 or fax your appeal to (202) 693-5538. Alternatively, you may email your appeal to foiaappeal@dol.gov;appeals submitted to any other email address will not be accepted.  Theenvelope (if mailed), subject line (if emailed), or fax cover sheet (if faxed),and the letter indicating the grounds for appeal, should be clearly marked:“Freedom of Information Act Appeal.” (mailto:foiaappeal@dol.gov) Inaddition to filing an appeal, you may contact the Department’s FOIA PublicLiaison, Ramona Oliver at (202) 731-5491or oliver.ramona@dol.gov (mailto:oliver.ramona@dol.gov) for assistance inresolving disputes You also may contact the Office of Government InformationServices (OGIS) for assistance.  OGIS offers mediation services to resolvedisputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusivealternative to litigation.  Using OGIS services does not affect your rightto pursue litigation.  You may mail OGIS at the Office of GovernmentInformation Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601Adelphi Road – OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001. Alternatively, you may email or contact OGIS through itswebsite at: ogis@nara.gov (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) ; Web: https://ogis.archives.gov (https://ogis.archives.gov/) .  Finally,you can call or fax OGIS at: telephone: (202) 741-5770; toll-free:1-877-684-6448. It is also important to note that the services offered byOGIS, is not an alternative to filing an administrative FOIA appeal. If we can be of further assistance to you, please feel freeto contact this office at 516-334-3344 or email skoch.joanna@dol.gov (mailto:skoch.joanna@dol.gov) 
Enclosure ATTACHMENT #1 Most used exemptions paragraphs from 5 U.S.C. Section 552(b): #4                  Information that is classifiedas trade secrets and/or of commercial or financial value obtained from a personand is privileged or a confidential source of information. #5                  Inter-agency or intra-agencymemorandums or letters which would not be available by law to a party otherthan an agency in litigation with the Agency. #6                  This exclusion is intended toexclude from disclosure all personal and medical files, and all private orpersonal information contained in other files which, if disclosed to thepublic, would amount to a clearly unwarranted invasion of the privacy of anyperson, including members of the family of the person to whom the informationpertains. #7                  Information contained ininvestigatory files complied for law enforcement purposes except to the extentavailable by law to a party other than an agency. #7(C)            Information pertaining to theprivacy interests of individuals, including                        information about anindividual which he could reasonably assert an option to withhold from thepublic at large because of its intimacy or its possible adverse effect uponhimself or his family. #7(D)            The identification of a confidentialsource or confidential information furnished by a confidential source.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SWAT Call Outs (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to SWAT call-outs:
SWAT includes SEB or any similar division at your agency
Data recorded by the department into a database or in reports that have:
- the deployment reasons/nature of each SWAT call-out (mental health, barricaded suspect, assist with federal or local partners, etc)
- any use of force, including the use of tear-gas and explosive breaching rounds
- deployment of any specialized equipment (drones, MRAPs)
- conclusion of call 
- dates
I don't need information on the who of the investigations; I need the what (use of force, specialized equipment) and why (deployment reason, conclusion of call) of each deployment. 

Please keep in native .csv if it's from a database.

Search 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Standardized Care Unit Financial Information (Office Of The City Manager)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Standardized Care Unit Financial Information (Office Of The City Manager)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- the budget and breakdowns of finances allocated to the Specialized Care Unit from August of 2023 to January of 2025
- the balance sheet and statement of cash flows generated by the Specialized Care Unit or whomever was responsible for the SCU in the Department of Behavioral Health, from the fiscal years of 2023 and 2024
- records of staffing within the Specialized Care Unit and the Bonita House Program (after the start of its partnership with the SCU in the 3rd quarter of 2023), including information regarding positions filled, salaries, benefits, and turnover rates

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

qq221

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: California DOE letters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The March 27, 2025, letter received by the California Department of Education from the United States Department of Education Student Privacy Policy Office regarding an investigation into compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act in relation to California Assembly Bill 1955. 2. Additional communication from the U.S. Department of Education to all Chief State Schools Officers and all Superintendents of Local Educational Agencies regarding obligations under FERPA, sent on March 28, 2025. 3. Any response from the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents to the U.S. Department of Education. 4. Any communication between the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents about federal communication or investigation.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association
Please see attached documents.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Fontana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Daijah Cano Arrest – May 13, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Daijah Cano on May 13, 2023, at approximately 12:31 AM, at or near 1200 Milton, Doña Ana County, NM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD).

Specifically, I am seeking:

The arrest report, including officer narratives, probable cause statements, and any citations or charges filed

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by arresting or responding officers

The 911 call audio and transcript, if one was made in connection with this incident

Any booking photos (mugshots) and related documentation

Any dispatch records or CAD logs for this incident

This request is made in the interest of transparency and public accountability in routine law enforcement actions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Reference # P000732-040625 Dear Thomas Jackson, The City of Las Cruces received the following public records request from you on April 07, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Daijah Cano on May 13, 2023, at approximately 12:31 AM, at or near 1200 Milton, Doña Ana County, NM, by the Las Cruces Police Department (LCPD). 

Specifically, I am seeking: 

The arrest report, including officer narratives, probable cause statements, and any citations or charges filed 

Any body-worn camera (BWC) footage recorded by arresting or responding officers 

The 911 call audio and transcript, if one was made in connection with this incident 

Any booking photos (mugshots) and related documentation 

Any dispatch records or CAD logs for this incident 

This request is made in the interest of transparency and public accountability in routine law enforcement actions. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Thomas Jackson 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Fdaijah-cano-arrest-may-13-2023-184476%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cCG%3A5PuP2nkpn6mu6Jnm5KeSvQ_UI6bHOLlxbrqmb5RYI5Y 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a notification relating to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). Under NMSA 1978, § 14-2-8, the City has determined that it does not have possession of and/or responsibility for the 911 call recordings or any other dispatch records that you have requested.  However, the City knows the proper custodian of these records to be Mesilla Valley Regional Dispatch Authority (MVRDA), 911 Lake Tahoe Ct., Las Cruces, NM, 88007, (575) 526-0795, https://www.mvrda.org/records-request-instructions/.  Under NMSA 1978, § 14-2-8, the City has also determined that it does not have possession of and/or responsibility for the booking photos or any other detention center records that you have requested. However, the City also knows the proper custodian of these records to be Doña Ana County (DAC), 845 N. Motel Blvd, Las Cruces, NM, 88007, 575-647-7600, https://recordbook.donaanacounty.org/home.  As such, on April 7, 2025 the City forwarded your request to MVRDA and DAC.  To expedite your request, you may consider submitting an additional records request to those agency's records custodians directly,  In light of this notification, the City considers the request for dispatch records closed. Thank you for your attention. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact our office. 
Please note that t he City will continue to search and review documents in response to the remainder of your request. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Flas-cruces-new-mexico-police-department-4431%252Fdaijah-cano-arrest-may-13-2023-184476%252F%253Femail%253Dkperalta%252540las-cruces.org&url_auth_token=AAAWk2FNE129jWDSFr7SU9dcyI4%3A1u1cCG%3A5PuP2nkpn6mu6Jnm5KeSvQ_UI6bHOLlxbrqmb5RYI5Y 
The purpose of this message is to provide you with a partial response to the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). The City has gathered, reviewed, and appropriately redacted the following public records associated with your request: 
One (1) document and four (4) videos 
 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) Section 14-2-1.1 states “Protected personal identifier information contained in public records may be redacted by a public body before inspection or copying of a record.” The term “protected personal identifier information” is defined within NMSA Section 14-2-6(F) to include:  (1) all but the last four digits of a: (a) taxpayer identification number;  (b) financial account number; (c) credit or debit card number; or (d) driver’s license number;  (2) all but the year of a person’s date of birth; (3) a social security number; and (4) with regard to a nonelected employee of a public body in the context of the person’s employment, the employee’s nonbusiness home street address, but not the city, state or zip code;  therefore, any of the above-described “protected personal identifier information” found within the responsive records have been redacted. 
  *  New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1.2(A)(8) states, in pertinent part, that “Law enforcement records are public records, except “records pertaining to physical or mental examination and medical treatment of persons unless the information could be relevant to a criminal investigation or an investigation of misfeasance, malfeasance or other suspected violation of law conducted by a person elected to or employed by a public body,” and therefore, such records “may be redacted from a written record or digitally obscured in a visual or audio record.” Therefore, any medical records and/or the discussion of medical diagnosis found within the responsive records have been redacted. New Mexico Statutes Annotated (hereinafter “NMSA”) 1978, § 14-2-1(J) states that every person has a right to inspect public records of this state except “information concerning information technology systems, the publication of which would reveal specific vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems; provided that this subsection shall not be used to restrict requests for (1) records stored or transmitted using information technology systems and (2) internal and external audits of information technology systems, except for those portions that would reveal ongoing vulnerabilities that compromise or allow unlawful access to such systems.” Therefore, any records that would disclose methods for unlawfully accessing technology systems contained within the responsive records have been redacted. A download link with the contents of this request has been e-mailed to you from AXON.  This download link expires in three (3) days. Please contact our office by replying to this email or via telephone if you have any issues accessing the documents or if you wish to receive the documents in another format. Pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, the City has determined that your written request is excessively burdensome and/or broad. More specifically, the City has determined that it requires an additional reasonable period of time to gather, review, and appropriately redact any and all public records associated with your request.  Although the City cannot anticipate when the remainder of the responsive records associated with your request will become available, the City will produce them within a reasonable period of time. Further, the City will provide a written status update regarding your request within fifteen (15) days. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Danyel Oliveras Arrest – February 12, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records related to the arrest of Danyel A. Oliveras on February 12, 2025, at approximately 11:07 AM, by the Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office. The arrest occurred at or near 1508 Diehl Dr., Hillsborough County, Florida.

According to public records, Oliveras was charged with the following offenses:

Eight counts of Possession of Child Pornography – Florida Statute CHAB0001

One count of In-State Transmission of Child Pornography via Electronic Device – Florida Statute LEWD6070A

One count of Transmission of Harmful Material to Minor – Florida Statute LEWD5080

One count of Unlawful Use of Two-Way Communications Device – Florida Statute MISC1354
Bond for each offense: $2,500

I am specifically requesting:

The full incident and arrest reports, including investigative summaries, detective narratives, and charging documents

Any available digital forensic reports, electronic evidence logs, or device search warrants

Body-worn camera (BWC) footage, if applicable, from the arrest or investigation

Photographs or digital evidence related to the case

CAD logs, dispatch records, or any communications between deputies and the subject

Documentation submitted to the State Attorney’s Office

Due to the serious nature of the charges involving electronic transmission of child exploitation materials, this request is made in the public interest to better understand the investigation and procedures surrounding these offenses.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Thomas Jackson

This email is to acknowledge your Public Records Act request submitted below. Appropriate University of California offices are being notified of your request and a search for the information is underway. All information identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and made available for your access, in accordance with relevant law and University policy. The estimated date for production of the requested records is on or around June 3, 2025.
  
Although the requested records have not yet been fully gathered and reviewed, it is possible that the material may contain information exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Public Records Act.  However, this is not a determination that the requested records are necessarily exempt from disclosure. This office will provide you with a status update after the requested records have been thoroughly reviewed.

Your request number is UCDPRA25192, please feel free to 'reply all', should you have any questions or need additional information as we work to complete your request. You are welcome to visit our Campus Counsel <https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/> website or Records Requests<https://ocpweb.ucdavis.edu/ccrs/public/request.cfm> portal for additional information concerning records requests.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on March 31, 2025. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (March 2025) (Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
Hi Rose,

I just saw this email as I was on vacation from 3/28 through 4/6.

On this email I’m copying my deputy, Jospeh Anderson, who also acts as the County Public Records Officer.

I thought it might be helpful to clarify what you’re looking for.  We don’t have a “Brady List” per se.  There is one deputy that works for the Skamania county Sheriff’s Office for whom we have potential impeachment information and for whom we provide a memo summarizing the circumstances.  We provide this memo when required to defense counsel on cases involving this deputy.  Because there is only one local deputy for whom we maintain PID information, there is no list.  Just the single memo, which we are happy to provide.

The Washington State Patrol sometimes sends us information from state-wide potential impeachment issues with WSP employees.  We do not maintain this information in any organized way because it does not apply to any officers that regularly appear in our courts/cases.  I just want to confirm that these records are not made into any list, and to the extent that these records are related to WSP employees, are likely better sought from the WSP directly, if you’re interested in the raw data (in addition to any lists).

Thanks for your patience and understanding.  Joseph will follow up with you acknowledging the request and will get you a copy of the PID memo I referenced above.

adam

communications.subject: [Records Center] County Public Records Request :: C003218-040825
communications.communication:
Attachments: 
Memorandum_Regarding_Potential_Impeachment_Information_Deputy_Ryan_Taylor.pdf (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXXKNHMGZjOd7qdQtHPrqDUSnThnOAjge8ztdyL9xIcfHcJ-2FbxPyhrYsO296qCMQ4kpjyYi-2FDrJgXOxB5EdBODHERxrquwtbT3Yezl4GfYRBcLzXH6x4sUnGrx06gu06gV3itamG6wT6vGhLju3lJi4NhabczqXu7boE3xAvtXGW6zjKgdTTImpKukxLZPwgXv37XS7qz62gClw8GRGUYsdc-3DbyDX_jPYi5oAjSPjqlNMvMYo8u0OyE08gUS84v5wkcQJksUQKcNltnqopThCrnD81Uqv6v7LneSumzv-2F1qbGk9BngaggFq-2BLk1GS8iHEEn9tju-2BQnBw7l-2F1I8-2BsqI9Vm-2BQU8z-2F7uzTT0Esl4ErvUa4rg9wIMdIKzSOsmhB4etsB-2FjBOs5jMzEqIyuWP5cKnJwTIUe1-2BrwOoMJnAmBn-2ByvVNQTcWHcAOaNGs63BqPccpqURkX0nTcO94Rajg-2Fef7AHf6WsBFOppGwrmOEgTnsgnT1VZC-2FnqxadhFvYr4wkVy0tn0j69B0VliUwZyVgMSubHVDcLrz7ohY9riflITGhH1i256pbZ1iCDqm6wjBAkEXuMy6JMBcaGmZL-2FQsrbIjCe8UK0tADLQVb3QYztt7WKgp7wg-3D-3D) 

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 07, 2025, Reference #C003218-040825 Dear Ms. Terse: Greetings. My name is Joseph Anderson and I am a Deputy Public Records Officer for Skamania County. I assist inreviewing and responding to public records requests (PRRs) for alldepartments. 

On April 07, 2025, I received your public records request for "All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes." 
As previously mentioned by Prosecutor Adam Kick in response to your request: " We don’t have a 'Brady List' per se.  There is one deputy that works for the Skamania County Sheriff’s Office for whom we have potential impeachment information and for whom we provide a memo summarizing the circumstances. We provide this memo when required to defense counsel on cases involving this deputy. Because there is only one local deputy for whom we maintain PID information, there is no list. Just the single memo, which we are happy to provide [please see attached]. The Washington State Patrol sometimes sends us information from state-wide potential impeachment issues with WSP employees. We do not maintain this information in any organized way because it does not apply to any officers that regularly appear in our courts/cases. I just want to confirm that these records are not made into any list, and to the extent that these records are related to WSP employees, are likely better sought from the WSP directly, if you’re interested in the raw data (in addition to any lists)." After reviewing our files, we have located records that are responsive to your request. Please log in to the Skamania County Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the records responsive to your request: County Public Records Request - C003218-040825 
SkamaniaCounty has searched for, attempted to identify, locate, and provide anynon-exempt public records that may be responsive to this request. Since this completely fulfills your request, we are now closing this public records request. The one (1) yearstatute of limitations to seek judicial review under the Public RecordsAct (Chapter 42.56 RCW) begins now because Skamania County does notintend to further address this request. Please note that if you do not review and download your records within thirty (30) days, they may be removed from the system, in which case you will have to start the public records process all over again to receive your requested records. 

Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns by replying to this email or at my phone number below. 

Sincerely, 

Joseph Anderson 
Deputy Public Records Officer 
Office of the Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney 
240 NW Vancouver Avenue | PO Box 790 
Stevenson, WA 98648 
509-427-3791

communications.subject: RE: UCDPRA25191
communications.communication:
Dear Ed Burton,

This email is to acknowledge your Public Records Act request submitted below. Appropriate University of California offices are being notified of your request and a search for the information is underway. All information identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and made available for your access, in accordance with relevant law and University policy. The estimated date for production of the requested records is on or around June 3, 2025.
  
Although the requested records have not yet been fully gathered and reviewed, it is possible that the material may contain information exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Public Records Act.  However, this is not a determination that the requested records are necessarily exempt from disclosure. This office will provide you with a status update after the requested records have been thoroughly reviewed.

Your request number is UCDPRA25191, please feel free to 'reply all', should you have any questions or need additional information as we work to complete your request. You are welcome to visit our Campus Counsel <https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/> website or Records Requests<https://ocpweb.ucdavis.edu/ccrs/public/request.cfm> portal for additional information concerning records requests. 


Thank you,

Aimee Villalpando-Jeffries (she/her/ella)
Information Practices Analyst
UC Legal – UC Davis Office of the Campus Counsel
One Shields Avenue, Davis, CA 95616
Phone: 530-754-8936
https://campuscounsel.ucdavis.edu/

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Nassau Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: FOIL Response Evergreen Solutions (Nassau Community College)
communications.communication:
I am writing to formally acknowledge and respond to your FOIL request (attached).  Documents which are responsive to your request may be accessed using the following link:



https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/rr9n0hos0825qo2fd85jg/ADV-ytxZhDOFUCu_xNvWDx8?rlkey=recf1hnt7h60sjlgljdmuksoo&st=dlq5ayxj&dl=0

The remainder of your request is denied to the extent that it seeks items which would constitute and unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and in that it is overbroad and seeks information not stored in any centralized manner.



You have the right to appeal this determination within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter to the FOIL Appeals Officer of Nassau County.



FOIL Appeals Officer

Office of the Nassau County Attorney

One West Street

Mineola, New York 11501



On behalf of the Office of General Counsel

One Education Drive

Garden City, NY 11530

Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

The below request, which was sent on March 6th, will be acknowledged on March 13th, in accordance with State law and College policy<https://www.sunysuffolk.edu/legalaffairs/services/foil.jsp>.

Alla Brodsky, Esq.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL]New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Suffolk County Community College, Selden)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

I am writing to formally acknowledge your Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”) request, received by the College on March 6, 2025.

The College will respond to this request, by providing the records requested, to the extent that they exist and may be disclosed, on or before April 10, 2025.

With respect to the numerous questions contained in your request, please note that Article 6 of the New York State Public Officers Law, known as the Freedom of Information Law (“FOIL”), permits members of the public to request and inspect “reasonably described” “records” of public agencies.  It is not, however, a mechanism for posing and receiving answers to written questions.  As stated in FOIL Advisory Opinion 16632a<https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f16632a.htm>, issued by the New York State Committee on Open Government:  “Very simply, there is nothing in the Freedom of Information Law or the Open Meetings Law that requires that government officers or employees respond to questions, supply information in response to questions or offer explanations for their governmental activities.”  Furthermore, as explained in FOIL Advisory Opinion 18795<https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/f18795.html>, “an agency need not create a record in response to a request for information.”  Therefore, to the extent that the College does not maintain records which may be responsive to several of the questions listed below (i.e., average tenure, current turnover rate, how frequently are job description updated), the FOIL statute does not require to a public agency to create records in order to respond to a FOIL request.

Note that once responsive records – i.e., the College’s payroll and collective bargaining agreements -  are gathered in response to this FOIL request, they may contain answers to some the questions posed below (i.e., how are salaries adjusted, date compensation plan(s) were implemented, do you compensate faculty differently based on the area of discipline, etc.).  However, the answers will be able to be retrieved from a review of the relevant collective bargaining agreements.


Alla Brodsky, Esq.
Deputy General Counsel
Suffolk County Community College
Ammerman Campus
Email: brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu<mailto:brodskya@sunysuffolk.edu>

PRIVILEGED & CONFIDENTIAL
ATTORNEY-CLIENT COMMUNICATION/ATTORNEY WORK PRODUCT
INTER-OFFICE/INTRA-AGENCY COMMUNICATION
NOT SUBJECT TO FOIL DISCLOSURE/NOT FOR DISTRIBUTION

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: South Alabama FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - DARPA - OpenBSD POSSE Funding
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning/making reference to the funding of the OpenBSD (www.openbsd.org) via the "Portable Open-Source Security Enhancements project" (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POSSE_project). According to wikipedia: "The project ran from 2001 to April 2003, when the grant from DARPA was prematurely terminated.", so please seek records created within that time-frame.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request 2025-03800-F
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, 
This is in response to an OSDreferral we have received regarding your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) casenumber 24-F-0045.  Your request notedbelow was loaded into our eFOIA system on 19-Mar-25, and assigned case number2025-03800-F: To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Freedom ofInformation Act, I hereby request the following records: All recordsmentioning/making reference to the funding of the OpenBSD (www.openbsd.org) viathe "Portable Open-Source Security Enhancements project"(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/POSSE_project). According to wikipedia:"The project ran from 2001 to April 2003, when the grant from DARPA wasprematurely terminated.", so please seek records created within thattime-frame. The requested documents willbe made available to the general public, and this request is not being made forcommercial purposes. In the event that there arefees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges inadvance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filledelectronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance foryour anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving yourresponse to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.” 
Our organization has a significantnumber of pending FOIA requests.  Therefore,we implemented multi-track processing for requests.  Based on yourrequested information, we placed your request in the Simple track. We estimateresponse to your request will be provided within 20 working days.  Our policy is to process requests within theirrespective tracks in the order we receive them.  FOIA requests areprocessed as quickly as possible. 
We placed you inthe “Other” fee category for processing.  Under this category,you may be charged for search and duplication (paper) costs.  The firsttwo hours of search time and the first 100 pages of duplication are furnishedwithout charge. 
If you have any questions, pleasecontact us at AFRL.RI.FOIAPrivacyOffice@us.af.mil and reference theabove FOIA case number. (mailto:AFRL.RI.FOIAPrivacyOffice@us.af.mil) 
Sincerely, 
AFRL/RI Freedom of Information ActOffice

title: Exit Ethics briefings (Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Exit Ethics briefings (Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All plans, memos, reports, briefings or “exit ethics” briefings created for the purpose of transferring institutional knowledge and offboarding personnel in the presidential transition from President Joe Biden to President-elect Donald J. Trump.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Kauffman

communications.subject: Important Update: ATF FOIA Requests System Migration
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Kauffman, 

We are writing to inform you of an important update regarding your FOIA request 2025-00014. The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) has successfully migrated to a new system, FOIAXpress, and introduced the FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) portal. This portal allows requesters to track their requests, submit new ones, and receive responsive documents securely. 
At this time, our office is prepared to release the responsive documents for your request. However, due to email file size restrictions, we can only provide access through the PAL portal. To retrieve your documents, please create an account at using the same email address you used to submit your request. Once your account is created, please https://foia-pal.atf.gov (https://foia-pal.atf.gov) notify us via the PAL messaging feature, and we will deliver the documents accordingly. 
Moving forward: 
 
  *  All FOIA request correspondence must be conducted exclusively through PAL. 
  *  All document releases will be handled via PAL. Email communications for FOIA requests will no longer be processed. 
If you encounter any technical issues or need assistance with PAL, please contact our support team at foia-pal-support@atf.gov 
Thank you for your cooperation as we transition to this improved system. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to continuing to assist you through the ATF FOIA PAL portal. Sincerely, 
ATF FOIA Team 
Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives Note: This message is sent via a system mailbox. This is not a monitored mailbox and replies to thisemail will not be seen or responded to. If you have any questions or concerns,please use the ATF FOIAXpress PAL portal’s correspondence feature to contactour office. You can access the portal by creating an account athttps://foia-pal.atf.gov. Additionally, you can contact the FOIA PublicLiaisons at 202-648-7390 for any further assistance and to discuss anyaspect of your request. For technical issue with PAL, please email foia-pal-support@atf.gov.Thank you for your understanding

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - CIA - Isaiah Berlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents mentioning Isaiah Berlin (June 6, 1909 – November 5, 1997) - philosopher, political scientist, and historian (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isaiah_Berlin).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.
